meanings.definition: Treatment or circumstances that cause feelings of shame or humiliation.
meanings.sent1: The constant indignities he faced at work made him feel small and embarrassed.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't bear the indignities of being laughed at by her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The cat's indignities at wearing a silly hat amused the whole family.
meanings.sent4: The indignities of being compared to a clumsy elephant stung her pride.
meanings.sent5: The vivid memory of the indignities he suffered haunted him for years.

meanings.definition: Acts or behaviors that are offensive or insulting.
meanings.sent1: The indignities shown by the bully towards the new student were unacceptable.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't forgive the indignities his boss had subjected him to.
meanings.sent3: The dog's indignities of stealing socks and hiding them in the garden were comical.
meanings.sent4: The indignities of the harsh words cut deeper than any physical pain.
meanings.sent5: The vivid image of the indignities inflicted on the character stayed with the readers.
